The 'Portuguese' () are a Western Romance nation and ethnic group native to
the country of Portugal, in the west of the Iberian Peninsula of Southwestern
Europe. Their language is Portuguese, and Roman Catholicism is the
predominant religion.

Historically, the Portuguese descend from the Pre-Celts who inhabbited the
Iberian Peninsula with the Lusitanians forming the manifold identity of the
country, followed by the Romans. Other major segments include the Suebi, the
Visigoths and the Gallaeci.

Due to the large historical extent of the Portuguese Empire and the colonization
of territories in Asia, Africa and the Americas, as well as historical and
recent emigration, Portuguese communities can be found in many diverse regions
around the globe, and a large Portuguese diaspora exists.
